title: Holding a predetermined belief about a group of...

content.prompt: Tremaine believes kids who go to his school's rival high school are arrogant and entitled since they live in a community that has a slightly higher socioeconomic status than his own community. At a birthday party one night at a friend's house, Tremaine meets Reynard and they find they have a lot in common. Tremaine is dismayed when he finds out the next day that Reynard goes to the rival high school. Tremaine holding a predetermined belief about a group of people, regardless of the personal qualities of the individual members, is referred to as which of the following?

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
